Articles.Content:
Hello ladies and gentlemen of the Kerbal Space Program Forums!

I\'ve been tinkering about a bit and I have taken the task of designing a similar version of the NASA Orbiter Shuttle inside of KSP.

I know this has been done before but I thought I\'d give it a try!

So, anyway this Shuttle handles superb but has a tendency to have it\'s nose pitch down most of the time due to inclined engines atop the Shuttle for when it is attached to SRB\' and larger fuel tank. Other than that it is remarkable. It does require full throttle at launch if launching horizontally on the runway and requires the entire strip to take off.

*NOTES PLEASE READ*

-The things I used to attach the engines are decouplers so DO NOT use the very last stage of the Shuttle unless you want to be a gliding brick.

-I have used the NovaPunch Pack (Link to thread down below)

-I\'m not sure how well it land\'s as my computer is very laggy and it\'s hard for me to land anything.

-This was created in the Space Plane Hangar.
